item.title: How to add a theme tab to any client
item.dc:creator: @Arightwizard Arightwizard
item.description:
@Arightwizard wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:1, topic:288602”]Hey guys, in this Tutorial i will be, hopefully, telling you how to create a Theme tab for your client.

First things first, BACK UP ANY FILES YOU USE!!

What you need. A Jframe / GUI File.

Purpose of this Tutorial. So People can change the colour of there client.

Ok, first things first, i need you to download this file;

…

Wow, over 140 views but hardly any replys, please post back guys…[/quote]

Hmmm…I was having problems with adding menus to clients without having any, and I saw this said “Any Client,” so I assumed I could come here and change a little bit for my own client. Apparently not, and this isn’t “Any Client.”
I’d suggest renaming it. I’m not trying to start a fight, I’m just pointing out that this will not work with every client out there.

Read full topic

Read full topic
item.source: How to add a theme tab to any client

item.title: How to add a theme tab to any client
item.dc:creator: @burnt_w_pwnt burnt w pwnt
item.description:
@burnt_w_pwnt wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:1, topic:288602”]Hey guys, in this Tutorial i will be, hopefully, telling you how to create a Theme tab for your client.

First things first, BACK UP ANY FILES YOU USE!!

What you need. A Jframe / GUI File.

Purpose of this Tutorial. So People can change the colour of there client.

Ok, first things first, i need you to download this file;

http://www.mediafire.com/?sharekey=090bbdca887779d307258ee67c679e4ae04e75f6e8ebb871

This if your theme file, it consists of all different colour

Ok, next i need you to open up your GUI/Jframe.java and search this

JMenuBar menuBar = new JMenuBar();

Ok, you will see codes looking similar to this one JMenu fileMenu = new JMenu("File");

So, straight under that code i need you to add this;

JMenu ThemeMenu = new JMenu("Themes");

This tells your Gui to add a new Menu called “Theme”

Ok, next i need you to search this;

String[] ThemeButtons = new String[]

Add this;

String[] ThemeButtons = new String[] { "Black", "Blue", "Red", "Green", "Grey", "White" }; for (String name : mainButtons) { JMenuItem menuItem = new JMenuItem(name); if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-")) fileMenu.addSeparator(); else { menuItem.addActionListener(this); fileMenu.add(menuItem); } }

Thats basically giving all the different colour types from which you can pick.

Now, search this,

for (String name : ThemeButtons)

Near the end of the code, you need to add this;

 menuBar.add(ThemeMenu);

That will clear up any unknown casses.

Thanks for reading my first ever tutorial on MoparScape,

Oh yeh, if you get any errors, just post on here and i will help you fix them.

~Johno[/quote]

WHat do i do if i dont have a GUI or Jframe.java?
all i got is EGUI.java and Frame_sub1

Read full topic

item.source: How to add a theme tab to any client

item.title: How to add a theme tab to any client
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

Hey guys, in this Tutorial i will be, hopefully, telling you how to create a Theme tab for your client.

First things first, BACK UP ANY FILES YOU USE!!

What you need. A Jframe / GUI File.

Purpose of this Tutorial. So People can change the colour of there client.

Ok, first things first, i need you to download this file;

http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?wimiozg1hyw

This if your theme file, it consists of all different colour

Ok, next i need you to open up your GUI/Jframe.java and search this

JMenuBar menuBar = new JMenuBar();

Ok, you will see codes looking similar to this one JMenu fileMenu = new JMenu("File");

So, straight under that code i need you to add this;

JMenu ThemeMenu = new JMenu("Themes");

This tells your Gui to add a new Menu called “Theme”

Ok, next i need you to search this;

String[] ThemeButtons = new String[]

Add this;

String[] ThemeButtons = new String[] { "Black", "Blue", "Red", "Green", "Grey", "White" }; for (String name : mainButtons) { JMenuItem menuItem = new JMenuItem(name); if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-")) fileMenu.addSeparator(); else { menuItem.addActionListener(this); fileMenu.add(menuItem); } }

Thats basically giving all the different colour types from which you can pick.

Now, search this,

for (String name : ThemeButtons)

Near the end of the code, you need to add this;

 menuBar.add(ThemeMenu);

That will clear up any unknown casses.

Thanks for reading my first ever tutorial on MoparScape,

Oh yeh, if you get any errors, just post on here and i will help you fix them.

~Johno

Wow, over 140 views but hardly any replys, please post back guys…

Read full topic
item.source: How to add a theme tab to any client
